title: Esmail Halali
text:
Esmail Halali (, born on August 13, 1973 in <a href="Tabriz">Tabriz</a>) is an Iranian retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and current manager of <a href="Mes%20Soongoun%20Varzaghan%20F.C.">Mes Soongoun</a>.
Playing career.
Club career.
He began his professional career with <a href="Tractor%20S.C.">Tractor</a> in 1989 and was promoted to the first-team squad in 1992. After the relegation of Tractor in 1995, he left the team and joins to <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a>. He played for Perseopolis seven season but was sell to <a href="Sanat%20Naft%20F.C.">Sanat Naft</a> at the end of the <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20Iran%20Pro%20League">2001–02 season</a>. He also played at the <a href="Paykan%20F.C.">Paykan</a>, <a href="Esteghlal%20Ahvaz%20F.C.">Esteghlal Ahvaz</a>, <a href="Shahrdari%20Bandar%20Abbas%20F.C.">Shahrdari Bandar Abbas</a> (in <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a>) and <a href="Shahin%20Bushehr%20F.C.">Shahin Bushehr</a> in the next years. He announced his retirement in July 2008 to starting his coaching period.
International career.
He was invited to the national team by <a href="Tomislav%20Ivi%C4%87">Tomislav Ivić</a> when he was played for <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a>. He has 15 caps at the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national football team</a> and also was part of the team in <a href="2000%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2000 AFC Asian Cup</a>.
Coaching career.
He was started his coaching career just months after his retirement at his beloved club, <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> as <a href="Hossein%20Abdi">Hossein Abdi</a>'s assistant in B team. After Abdi resigned, he was named as the B team's head coach by chairman <a href="Habib%20Kashani">Habib Kashani</a> on 1 July 2010. Under his management, Persepolis won the <a href="Tehran%20Provincial%20League">Tehran Provincial League</a> and was promoted to the <a href="Iran%20Football%27s%203rd%20Division">3rd Division</a>. They also won the <a href="Tehran%20Hazfi%20Cup">Tehran Hazfi Cup</a> at the same season and made a <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29">Double</a>, the first B team to doing so.
